tickerNews.title: BUMI Plans to Write Off US$2.35 Billion Retained Earnings Deficit
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources (BUMI) on Tuesday (23/4) announced a plan to conduct a quasi reorganization using the consolidated financial statements as of December 31, 2023. This plan will be discussed at the EGMS on May 30, 2024. A quasi reorganization itself is an accounting procedure to restructure equity by eliminating the negative retained earnings balance. Through this corporate action, BUMI will eliminate its retained earnings deficit which reached 2.35 billion US dollars as of 2023. In return, BUMI's paid-in capital top-up of 2.05 billion US dollars will decrease to minus 298.69 million US dollars. The net equity of BUMI will not change. BUMI management explained in the information disclosure that there are several benefits from the quasi reorganization, including: - Providing a true picture of the company's financial condition without being burdened by past deficits. - With no deficit balance, the company can distribute dividends. - Without the burden of past deficits, the company is expected to find it easier to obtain funding for business development. BUMI last distributed dividends in 2012. Based on Law Number 40 of 2007, dividends can only be distributed if the company's retained earnings balance is positive. Besides BUMI, several issuers have previously conducted a quasi reorganization, such as Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) in 2013 and Solusi Bangun Indonesia (SMCB) in 2010. Key Takeaway: The potential for the company to resume dividend payments can increase BUMI's attractiveness in the eyes of investors, although its dividend paying capacity is not as large as other coal producers such as ADRO, ITMG, and PTBA which have stronger financial positions (net cash position). Based on its financial position and 2023 performance, BUMI has the ability to pay dividends. As of December 2023, BUMI had cash of 76.8 million US dollars, debt of 306.6 million US dollars, and equity of 2.77 billion US dollars, resulting in a Net Debt to Equity Ratio at the level of 0.08x. Operationally, BUMI booked operating profit of 56.8 million US dollars with interest expense of 22.5 million US dollars, resulting in a net profit of 10.9 million US dollars. On Tuesday (23/4), the market responded positively to this quasi reorganization plan, with BUMI's stock price rising +21.18% to 103 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: BBCA: Net Profit 1Q24 Grew +11.7% YoY; Loan Growth +17.1% YoY
tickerNews.content: BBCA: Bank Central Asia recorded a net profit of 12.9 trillion rupiah (+5.4% QoQ, +11.7% YoY) in 1Q24, slightly below consensus expectations as it only reached 24% of the FY24 consensus estimate. This result was driven by Net Interest Income which increased to 19.8 trillion rupiah (+2% QoQ, +7% YoY), causing Pre-Provision Operating Profit to rise to 16.9 trillion rupiah (+9.4% QoQ, +8.5% YoY). Provision expenses in 1Q24 were recorded at 1 trillion rupiah (an increase QoQ from zero in 4Q23, -30% YoY). In terms of operations, disbursed credit grew +17.1% YoY, exceeding management guidance which targeted 8-10% growth, while the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio rose to 71.2% (vs. 2023: 70.2%).

tickerNews.title: Report: PANI Allegedly to Conduct Another Rights Issue in 3Q24
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg Technoz reported that Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua plans to conduct its third rights issue in 3Q24. According to an anonymous source to Bloomberg Technoz, PANI is targeting funds not significantly different from the second rights issue in 2023, which was around 10 trillion rupiah. Responding to this news, PANI Corporate Secretary, Christy Grassela, stated that they were unaware of the news, although confirming that the company will continue to develop the PIK 2 area.

tickerNews.title: HMSP Announces 2023 Dividend Payout of IDR 806 Billion
tickerNews.content: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna will distribute a dividend for the 2023 fiscal year of approximately 8.1 trillion rupiah or ~69.3 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation markets is May 2, 2024, with payment on May 17, 2024. Referring to HMSP's stock price at the close of trading on Tuesday (23/4) at 855 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 8.1%.

tickerNews.title: UNTR Operational Update March 2024: Komatsu Sales Hit 301 Units in March
tickerNews.content: United Tractors recorded sales of Komatsu heavy equipment amounting to 301 units in March 2024 (-2% MoM, -46.2% YoY). For 1Q24, Komatsu sales decreased by -37.1% YoY to 1,126 units, with market share dropping to 29% (vs. 1Q23: 32%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 32.3 million tons (+21% YoY) in 1Q24, with overburden removal at 286.3 million bcm (+16.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: INTP's Cement Sales Volume Grew +7.1% YoY in March 2024, Market Share Rose to 29.5%
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a cement sales volume growth of +7.1% YoY in March 2024, with total market share rising to 29.5% (vs. March 2023: 27.7%) even though national sales volume dropped -0.9% YoY. Sales volume growth was driven by growth in Java Island (+13.4% YoY), with market share rising to 38.4% (vs. February 2023: 33.2%). Meanwhile, sales volume outside Java Island decreased by -2.6% YoY with market share declining to 19.0% (vs. March 2023: 19.8%).

tickerNews.title: ESSA 1Q24 Net Profit Reached US$10.2 Million, Net Profit Margin Increased to 13.8%
tickerNews.content: ESSA Industries Indonesia recorded a net profit of 10.2 million US dollars (-59% QoQ, +228% YoY) in 1Q24, equivalent to 17% of the FY24 consensus estimate. Although revenue decreased to 73.8 million US dollars (-34% QoQ, -16% YoY), cost of goods sold decreased deeper (-19% QoQ, -33% YoY) due to lower fabrication costs (-17% QoQ, -48% YoY). This caused the net profit margin to increase to 13.8% (vs. 1Q23: 3.5%).

tickerNews.title: Kontan Reports Djarum Group Plans to Acquire SSIA Shares
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Djarum group plans to acquire shares of Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA). Although, Kontan's anonymous source did not know the details of the rumor, including the transaction value and the selling party. PT Djarum declined to comment on this issue, while VP Head of Investor Relations SSIA, Erlin Budiman, stated that there had been no announcement from their side.

tickerNews.title: MPMX Plans Expansion into Battery Repair and Electricity Sales Business
tickerNews.content: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika (MPMX) plans to expand its business activities into the electric battery and accumulator repair, electricity sales, and other supporting electricity activities. This business expansion is aimed at broadening the business segment offering electrical products. This plan will be discussed at the AGM on May 29, 2024.

tickerNews.title: DOID Shareholders Approve Capital Reduction and Share Buyback Plans
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Delta Dunia Makmur (DOID) approved a capital reduction plan by repurchasing 422.4 million (4.9%) treasury shares. After this transaction, the number of DOID outstanding shares became 8.2 billion shares. In addition, DOID shareholders also approved a share buyback plan of up to 819.9 million (10%) shares.

tickerNews.title: ADMF's New Financing Growth Reached +3% YoY to IDR 11 Trillion in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: Adira Dinamika Multi Finance (ADMF) Director, Sylvanus Gani M., stated that the company recorded new financing growth of +3% YoY to 11 trillion rupiah in 1Q24. ADMF targets new financing growth of 10-12% during 2024. As of March 2023, the Non-Performing Financing (NPF) ratio stood at 2%.

tickerNews.title: BSML Plans Rights Issue Up to 400 Million New Shares, Funds for Ship Purchase and Debt Repayment
tickerNews.content: Bintang Samudera Mandiri Lines (BSML) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 400 million new shares with a ratio of 46,255,625:10,000,000 and dilution effect up to 17.8%. The subscription price will range from 250-300 rupiah per share, resulting in a maximum potential fund realization of 103.2-120 billion rupiah. The funds are intended for the purchase of 1 tugboat unit and 1 barge unit, partial repayment of debt to Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and company working capital. The main shareholder and ultimate beneficiary owner of BSML, PT Goldfive Investment Capital and Nengah Rama Gautama, will transfer all their rights to public investors. Cum right in the regular and negotiation markets is on June 28, 2024.
